formDescription: Well done in taking steps to explore how you can secure your business. This quiz will take roughtly 5-10minutes. You will be able to print a report at the end of the quiz with suggestions on things you can do to improve your business safety and security.

pages.title: Property Safety Quiz
pages.description:
Introduction blurb: Well done in taking steps to explore how you can secure your business premises. This quiz will take roughtly 5-10minutes. You will be able to print a report at the end of the quiz with suggestions on things you can do to improve your business safety and security. 

If you have any questions or would like to talk about your business safety you can contact a Territory Business Advisor on 1800 193 111 or businessinfo@nt.gov.au
If you have experienced a crime and would like support you can contact Victims of Crime NT:
Level 2, 71 Smith St, Darwin City, Darwin 0800. PH: 08 8941 0995
4/15 Leichardt Tce, Alice Springs 0871, PH: 08 8952 4466

Disclaimer
Laws and regulations can change over time. While we aim to provide accurate guidance and point you to helpful resources, it’s important that you check whether the information is suitable for your specific situation. Every business is different, so please make sure any advice or material you use is right for your circumstances before making decisions or taking action.

fields.label: Do you use any of the following security measures to keep your business safe?

options.label: Reinforced security glass or security film
Electronic security system / intruder Alarm System
Security screens or bars on widows and doors
Sensor lights or timed lights on entry and exit
High quality locks on windows and doors (deadbolts)
Doorbell or system to notify when someone walks in

fields.label: CCTV System: Quick Check. Answer yes if you tick all 5 points 1. Does your CCTV setup have everything you need... 2. Do you have signs up... 3. Is your CCTV setup following the rules... 4. Can you or your team check the footage from outside... 5. Is the footage stored safely...
fields.description: Effective CCTV includes clear signage, proper coverage, secure storage, and remote access. Review your system regularly to stay compliant and protected.

pages.title: Staff Safety
pages.description:
Introduction blurb: Well done in taking steps to explore how you increase your staff safety. This quiz will take roughtly 5-10minutes. You will be able to download a report at the end of the quiz with suggestions on things you can do to improve your business staff safety. If you have any questions or would like to talk about your business safety you can contact:
NT Worksafe on 1800 019 115 or ntworksafe@nt.gov.au
or a Territory Business Advisor on 1800 193 111 or businessinfo@nt.gov.au

If you or your staff have experienced a crime and would like support you can contact Victims of Crime NT:
Level 2, 71 Smith St, Darwin City, Darwin 0800. PH: 08 8941 0995
4/15 Leichardt Tce, Alice Springs 0871, PH: 08 8952 4466

Disclaimer
Laws and regulations can change over time. While we aim to provide accurate guidance and point you to helpful resources, it’s important that you check whether the information is suitable for your specific situation. Every business is different, so please make sure any advice or material you use is right for your circumstances before making decisions or taking action.

fields.label: Is your business premises open to the public?
Does your business have a visitor sign in sheet
Does your business have doorbells to indicate when a customer comes in?
Is there CCTV that captures entry/exit points at your business?
Does your business have a clearly labelled staff only space?
Are there multiple entry and exit points at your business?
Are entry and exit points well lit, including car parks?
fields.description: This is particularly important if staff are entering or exiting your business when it is dark.

fields.label: When on site all keys, including personal keys, are always stored out of sight, or are with staff.
Are employee's trained in locking/unlocking procedures?
Do you keep and maintain a key (or code) register for your business?
fields.description: A keycode register (or key register) is a secure record that tracks all keys used in a business, including their unique codes, what they unlock, who has them, and when they were issued or returned. It helps manage access, improve accountability, and reduce the risk of lost or misused keys.

fields.label: If you have a coded door lock, do you ensure that staff have individual codes?
Do you have protocols for changing entry codes / return of keys when staff members leave?
If a set of keys were lost is there anything that identifies they belong to your business?
Do you and your staff have access to a phone or emergency distress button in a common area?
fields.description: An emergency distress button is a safety device that, when pressed, sends an immediate alert to security or emergency services. It's used in situations where someone feels threatened or needs urgent help, allowing for a quick response without having to speak or make a call.

pages.title: Mobile Business
pages.description:
Introduction blurb: Well done in taking steps to explore how you increase your staff safety. This quiz will take roughtly 5-10minutes. You will be able to download a report at the end of the quiz with suggestions on things you can do to improve your business staff safety. If you have any questions or would like to talk about your business safety you can contact:
NT Worksafe on 1800 019 115 or ntworksafe@nt.gov.au
or a Territory Business Advisor on 1800 193 111 or businessinfo@nt.gov.au

Disclaimer
Laws and regulations can change over time. While we aim to provide accurate guidance and point you to helpful resources, it’s important that you check whether the information is suitable for your specific situation. Every business is different, so please make sure any advice or material you use is right for your circumstances before making decisions or taking action.

fields.label: Do you or your staff visit peoples homes as part of your business operations?
Does your business have risk assessment processes for this?
fields.description: Risk assessment for a business that visits people’s homes is the process of identifying possible dangers, like unsafe environments, aggressive behavior, or health risks, then planning how to reduce or manage those risks to keep staff safe during visits.

fields.label: Do you and your staff know what to do if faced with a security or safety risk while visiting someones home?
Are you or your staff trained in risk identification and management in people's homes?
fields.description: Risk identification is about looking around your business or work activities and asking, “What could go wrong?” It’s the first step in keeping people safe. You think about things like injuries, damage, or anything that might stop work. Once you spot those risks, you can plan how to avoid or manage them.

pages.title: Vehicle or Fleet Safety
pages.description:
Introduction blurb: Well done in taking steps to explore how you increase the safety of your vehicle and fleet management. This quiz will take roughtly 5-10minutes. You will be able to download a report at the end of the quiz with suggestions on things you can do to improve your business staff safety. If you have any questions or would like to talk about your business safety you can contact:
NT Worksafe on 1800 019 115 or ntworksafe@nt.gov.au
or a Territory Business Advisor on 1800 193 111 or businessinfo@nt.gov.au

Disclaimer
Laws and regulations can change over time. While we aim to provide accurate guidance and point you to helpful resources, it’s important that you check whether the information is suitable for your specific situation. Every business is different, so please make sure any advice or material you use is right for your circumstances before making decisions or taking action.

fields.label: Does your business operate from or use vehicles?
Are your vehicles fitted with any of these security features?
Are the vehicle/s well maintained and regularly serviced?
fields.description: A well-maintained vehicle is one that is regularly serviced, kept clean, and checked for safety issues like brakes, lights, tyres, and fluid levels, making it reliable and safe to drive.

fields.label: Are your vehicle stored in a safe, locked and well lit area when not in use?
Do staff travel to remote areas in company vehicles where they may have no phone reception or wifi whilst in transit?
Do they receive additional training on what to do in emergency situations?
Do they have additional communication equipment for their safety?
